intro: Burtonia diosmifolia var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved burtonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. The variety glabrescens is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other varieties of Burtonia.
